capabilities.description: Unifi Protect Backup is able to chown files.
capabilities.name: CHOWN

capabilities.description: Unifi Protect Backup is able bypass permission checks for it's sub-processes.
capabilities.name: FOWNER

capabilities.description: Unifi Protect Backup is able to set group ID for it's sub-processes.
capabilities.name: SETGID

capabilities.description: Unifi Protect Backup is able to set user ID for it's sub-processes.
capabilities.name: SETUID

app_metadata.description: Unifi Protect Backup is a python based tool for backing up UniFi Protect event clips as they occur.
app_metadata.name: unifi-protect-backup

run_as_context.description: Unifi Protect Backup runs as root user.

app_metadata.title: Unifi Protect Backup

attrs.label: Unifi Protect Username
attrs.description: Username to login to Unifi Protect instance

attrs.label: Unifi Protect Password
attrs.description: Password for Unifi Protect user

attrs.label: Unifi Protect Address
attrs.description: Address of Unifi Protect instance

attrs.label: Unifi Protect Port
attrs.description: Port of Unifi Protect instance

attrs.label: Unifi Protect Verify SSL
attrs.description: Verify SSL certificate of Unifi Protect instance

attrs.label: Skip Missing
attrs.description: If set, events which are 'missing' at the start will be ignored.

attrs.label: Ignore Cameras
attrs.description: IDs of cameras for which events should not be backed up. One per line.

attrs.label: Detection Types
attrs.description: Types of detections to back up. One per line.

attrs.label: Rclone Destination
attrs.description:
Rclone destination path in the format {rclone-remote}:{path-on-remote} </br.>
E.g. `gdrive:/backups/unifi_protect`

attrs.label: Rclone Arguments
attrs.description:
Optional extra arguments to pass to rclone rcat directly. One per line</br>
Common usage for this would be to set a bandwidth limit</br>
E.g. --bwlimit 8M

attrs.label: Rclone Purge Arguments
attrs.description:
Optional extra arguments to pass to rclone delete. One per line</br>
Common usage for this would be to execute a permanent delete
instead of using the recycle bin on a destination.</br>
Google Drive example: --drive-use-trash=false

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for Unifi Protect Backup.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that Unifi Protect Backup files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Unifi Protect Backup files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.

attrs.label: Unifi Protect Backup Config Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Unifi Protect Backup Config.

attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to a persistent volume claim.

1.0.9.readme:
Unifi Protect Backup

Unifi Protect Backup is a python based tool for backing up UniFi Protect event clips as they occur.
